intro: Rhyncholacis varians var. tricholoba, commonly known as the hairy-stalked rhyncholacis, is a rare and specialized plant species characterized by its unique morphological features. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is typically found in specific microhabitats with particular soil and moisture conditions. The plant exhibits distinctive trichomes on its stems, which contribute to its common name. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are small and clustered. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
